description: Young workers in low-income, entry-level jobs often have to juggle family responsibilities and could use more help. Read more at straitstimes.com.
title: Flexible work arrangements can’t be for just well-paid professionals
title_page: Flexible work arrangements can’t be for just well-paid professionals | The Straits Times
maintext:
Shorter work week, longer parental leave, flexibility for new parents and caregivers – there is currently strong emphasis on flexi-work and work-life balance.
In Singapore, a tripartite workgroup has been formed to develop flexi-work arrangements (FWAs), including flexi-time, flexi-place and flexi-workload.
